display.operation: Get list of Media Services Streaming Endpoint Metrics definitions.
display.description: Get list of Media Services Streaming Endpoint Metrics definitions.

metricSpecifications.name: Egress
metricSpecifications.displayDescription: The amount of Egress data, in bytes.

metricSpecifications.name: SuccessE2ELatency
metricSpecifications.displayDescription: The average latency for successful requests in milliseconds.

metricSpecifications.name: Requests
metricSpecifications.displayDescription: Requests to a Streaming Endpoint.

metricSpecifications.name: EgressBandwidth
metricSpecifications.displayDescription: Egress bandwidth in bits per second.

metricSpecifications.name: CPU
metricSpecifications.displayDescription: CPU usage for premium streaming endpoints. This data is not available for standard streaming endpoints.

display.operation: Get a list of Media Services Live Event Metrics definitions.
display.description: Get a list of Media Services Live Event Metrics definitions.

metricSpecifications.name: IngestBitrate
metricSpecifications.displayDescription: The incoming bitrate ingested for a live event, in bits per second.

metricSpecifications.name: IngestLastTimestamp
metricSpecifications.displayDescription: Last timestamp ingested for a live event.

metricSpecifications.name: IngestDriftValue
metricSpecifications.displayDescription: Drift between the timestamp of the ingested content and the system clock, measured in seconds per minute. A non zero value indicates that the ingested content is arriving slower than system clock time.

metricSpecifications.name: LiveOutputLastTimestamp
metricSpecifications.displayDescription: Timestamp of the last fragment uploaded to storage for a live event output.

metricSpecifications.name: AssetQuota
metricSpecifications.displayDescription: How many assets are allowed for current media service account

metricSpecifications.name: AssetCount
metricSpecifications.displayDescription: How many assets are already created in current media service account

metricSpecifications.name: AssetQuotaUsedPercentage
metricSpecifications.displayDescription: Asset used percentage in current media service account

metricSpecifications.name: ContentKeyPolicyQuota
metricSpecifications.displayDescription: How many content key polices are allowed for current media service account

metricSpecifications.name: ContentKeyPolicyCount
metricSpecifications.displayDescription: How many content key policies are already created in current media service account

metricSpecifications.name: ContentKeyPolicyQuotaUsedPercentage
metricSpecifications.displayName: Content Key Policy quota used percentage
metricSpecifications.displayDescription: Content Key Policy used percentage in current media service account

metricSpecifications.name: StreamingPolicyQuota
metricSpecifications.displayDescription: How many streaming policies are allowed for current media service account

metricSpecifications.name: StreamingPolicyCount
metricSpecifications.displayDescription: How many streaming policies are already created in current media service account

metricSpecifications.name: StreamingPolicyQuotaUsedPercentage
metricSpecifications.displayDescription: Streaming Policy used percentage in current media service account

metricSpecifications.name: ChannelsAndLiveEventsCount
metricSpecifications.displayDescription: The total number of live events in the current media services account

metricSpecifications.name: RunningChannelsAndLiveEventsCount
metricSpecifications.displayDescription: The total number of running live events in the current media services account

metricSpecifications.name: MaxChannelsAndLiveEventsCount
metricSpecifications.displayDescription: The maximum number of live events allowed in the current media services account

metricSpecifications.name: MaxRunningChannelsAndLiveEventsCount
metricSpecifications.displayDescription: The maximum number of running live events allowed in the current media services account

display.operation: Generates a streaming token which can be used for video playback
display.description: Generates a streaming token which can be used for video playback
Create or Update any Access Policy
Create or Update any Edge Module

Creates a new provisioning token. A provisioning token allows for a single instance of Azure Video analyzer IoT edge module to be initialized and authorized to the cloud account. The provisioning token itself is short lived and it is only used for the initial handshake between IoT edge module and the cloud. After the initial handshake, the IoT edge module will agree on a set of authentication keys which will be auto-rotated as long as the module is able to periodically connect to the cloud. A new provisioning token can be generated for the same IoT edge module in case the module state lost or reset
